member.name: T:System.Transactions.TransactionStatus
member.summary: Describes the current status of a distributed transaction.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionStatus.Aborted
member.summary: The transaction has been rolled back.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionStatus.Active
member.summary: The status of the transaction is unknown, because some participants must still be polled.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionStatus.Committed
member.summary: The transaction has been committed.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionStatus.InDoubt
member.summary: The status of the transaction is unknown.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.TransactionStartedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a class.
member.param: The source of the event.
The that contains the transaction from which transaction information can be retrieved.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption
member.summary: Provides additional options for creating a transaction scope.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption.Required
member.summary: A transaction is required by the scope. It uses an ambient transaction if one already exists. Otherwise, it creates a new transaction before entering the scope. This is the default value.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption.RequiresNew
member.summary: A new transaction is always created for the scope.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption.Suppress
member.summary: The ambient transaction context is suppressed when creating the scope. All operations within the scope are done without an ambient transaction context.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.TransactionScopeAsyncFlowOption
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Specifies whether transaction flow across thread continuations is enabled for .

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionScopeAsyncFlowOption.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies that transaction flow across thread continuations is enabled.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.TransactionScopeAsyncFlowOption.Suppress
member.summary: Specifies that transaction flow across thread continuations is suppressed.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.TransactionScope
member.summary: Makes a code block transactional. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.Transaction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the specified transaction as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work done inside the scope uses this transaction.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.Transaction,System.Transactions.TransactionScopeAsyncFlowOption)
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the specified transaction as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work done inside the scope uses this transaction.
member.param: The transaction to be set as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work done inside the scope uses this transaction.

An instance of the enumeration that describes whether the ambient transaction associated with the transaction scope will flow across thread continuations when using Task or async/await .NET async programming patterns.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeAsyncFlowOption)
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified asynchronous flow option.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified requirements.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.Transaction,System.TimeSpan,System.Transactions.TransactionScopeAsyncFlowOption)
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified timeout value, and sets the specified transaction as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work done inside the scope uses this transaction.
member.param: The transaction to be set as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work done inside the scope uses this transaction.
The after which the transaction scope times out and aborts the transaction.

An instance of the enumeration that describes whether the ambient transaction associated with the transaction scope will flow across thread continuations when using Task or async/await .NET async programming patterns.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,System.Transactions.TransactionOptions,System.Transactions.TransactionScopeAsyncFlowOption)
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified requirements and asynchronous flow option.
member.param: An instance of the enumeration that describes the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.

A structure that describes the transaction options to use if a new transaction is created. If an existing transaction is used, the timeout value in this parameter applies to the transaction scope. If that time expires before the scope is disposed, the transaction is aborted.

An instance of the enumeration that describes whether the ambient transaction associated with the transaction scope will flow across thread continuations when using Task or async/await .NET async programming patterns.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.TransactionScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,System.Transactions.TransactionOptions,System.Transactions.TransactionOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified requirements.
member.param: An instance of the enumeration that describes the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.

member.summary: Indicates that all operations within the scope are completed successfully.
member.exception: This method has already been called once.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment
member.summary: Provides a set of callbacks that facilitate communication between a participant enlisted for Single Phase Commit and the transaction manager when the notification is received.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment.Aborted
member.summary: Represents a callback that is used to indicate to the transaction manager that the transaction should be rolled back.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment.Aborted(System.Exception)
member.summary: Represents a callback that is used to indicate to the transaction manager that the transaction should be rolled back, and provides an explanation.
member.param: An explanation of why a rollback is initiated.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment.Committed
member.summary: Represents a callback that is used to indicate to the transaction manager that the SinglePhaseCommit was successful.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment.InDoubt
member.summary: Represents a callback that is used to indicate to the transaction manager that the status of the transaction is in doubt.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment.InDoubt(System.Exception)
member.summary: Represents a callback that is used to indicate to the transaction manager that the status of the transaction is in doubt, and provides an explanation.
member.param: An explanation of why the transaction is in doubt.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.PreparingEnlistment
member.summary: Facilitates communication between an enlisted transaction participant and the transaction manager during the Prepare phase of the transaction.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.PreparingEnlistment.ForceRollback
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction should be rolled back.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.PreparingEnlistment.ForceRollback(System.Exception)
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction should be rolled back.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.PreparingEnlistment.Prepared
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction can be committed.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.PreparingEnlistment.RecoveryInformation
member.summary: Gets the recovery information of an enlistment.
member.returns: The recovery information of an enlistment.
member.exception: An attempt to get recovery information inside a volatile enlistment, which does not generate any recovery information.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.ITransactionPromoter
member.summary: Describes a delegated transaction for an existing transaction that can be escalated to be managed by the MSDTC when needed.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.ITransactionPromoter.Promote
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that an escalation of the delegated transaction has been requested.
member.returns: A transmitter/receiver propagation token that marshals a distributed transaction. For more information, see .

member.name: T:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the isolation level of a transaction.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel.Chaos
member.summary: The pending changes from more highly isolated transactions cannot be overwritten.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Volatile data cannot be read during the transaction, but can be modified.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel.ReadUncommitted
member.summary: Volatile data can be read and modified during the transaction.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Volatile data can be read but not modified during the transaction. New data can be added during the transaction.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel.Serializable
member.summary: Volatile data can be read but not modified, and no new data can be added during the transaction.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel.Snapshot
member.summary: Volatile data can be read. Before a transaction modifies data, it verifies if another transaction has changed the data after it was initially read. If the data has been updated, an error is raised. This allows a transaction to get to the previously committed value of the data.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.IsolationLevel.Unspecified
member.summary: A different isolation level than the one specified is being used, but the level cannot be determined. An exception is thrown if this value is set.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.ISinglePhaseNotification
member.summary: Describes a resource object that supports single phase commit optimization to participate in a transaction.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.ISinglePhaseNotification.SinglePhaseCommit(System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment)
member.summary: Represents the resource manager's implementation of the callback for the single phase commit optimization.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.ISimpleTransactionSuperior
member.summary: Represents a transaction that is not a root transaction, but can be escalated to be managed by the MSDTC.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.ISimpleTransactionSuperior.Rollback
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that the transaction is being rolled back.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.IPromotableSinglePhaseNotification
member.summary: Describes an object that acts as a commit delegate for a non-distributed transaction internal to a resource manager.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IPromotableSinglePhaseNotification.Initialize
member.summary: Notifies a transaction participant that enlistment has completed successfully.
member.exception: An attempt to enlist or serialize a transaction.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IPromotableSinglePhaseNotification.Rollback(System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment)
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that the transaction is being rolled back.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IPromotableSinglePhaseNotification.SinglePhaseCommit(System.Transactions.SinglePhaseEnlistment)
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that the transaction is being committed.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.IEnlistmentNotification
member.summary: Describes an interface that a resource manager should implement to provide two phase commit notification callbacks for the transaction manager upon enlisting for participation.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IEnlistmentNotification.Commit(System.Transactions.Enlistment)
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that a transaction is being committed.
member.param: An object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IEnlistmentNotification.InDoubt(System.Transactions.Enlistment)
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that the status of a transaction is in doubt.
member.param: An object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IEnlistmentNotification.Prepare(System.Transactions.PreparingEnlistment)
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that a transaction is being prepared for commitment.
member.param: A object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IEnlistmentNotification.Rollback(System.Transactions.Enlistment)
member.summary: Notifies an enlisted object that a transaction is being rolled back (aborted).
member.param: A object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.IDtcTransaction
member.summary: Describes a DTC transaction.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.IDtcTransaction.GetTransactionInfo(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a transaction.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.HostCurrentTransactionCallback
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for the hosting environment to supply its own default notion of .
member.returns: A object.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.EnterpriseServicesInteropOption
member.summary: Specifies how distributed transactions interact with COM+ transactions.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.EnterpriseServicesInteropOption.Automatic
member.summary: Search for an existing COM+ context and synchronize with it if one exists.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.EnterpriseServicesInteropOption.Full
member.summary: The context (which can be retrieved by calling the static method of the class) and the ambient transaction (which can be retrieved by calling the static method of the class) are always synchronized. This introduces a performance penalty because new contexts may need to be created.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.EnterpriseServicesInteropOption.None
member.summary: There is no synchronization between and .

member.name: T:System.Transactions.EnlistmentOptions
member.summary: Determines whether the object should be enlisted during the prepare phase.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.EnlistmentOptions.EnlistDuringPrepareRequired
member.summary: The object must enlist during the initial phase of the commitment process.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.EnlistmentOptions.None
member.summary: The object does not require enlistment during the initial phase of the commitment process.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.Enlistment
member.summary: Facilitates communication between an enlisted transaction participant and the transaction manager during the final phase of the transaction.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.Enlistment.Done
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction participant has completed its work.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.DependentTransaction
member.summary: Describes a clone of a transaction providing guarantee that the transaction cannot be committed until the application comes to rest regarding work on the transaction. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.DependentTransaction.Complete
member.summary: Attempts to complete the dependent transaction.
member.exception: Any attempt for additional work on the transaction after this method is called. These include invoking methods such as , , , , or any serialization operations on the transaction.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.DependentCloneOption
member.summary: Controls what kind of dependent transaction to create.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.DependentCloneOption.BlockCommitUntilComplete
member.summary: The dependent transaction blocks the commit process of the transaction until the parent transaction times out, or is called. In this case, additional work can be done on the transaction and new enlistments can be created.

member.name: F:System.Transactions.DependentCloneOption.RollbackIfNotComplete
member.summary: The dependent transaction automatically aborts the transaction if Commit is called on the parent transaction before is called.

member.name: T:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction
member.summary: Describes a committable transaction.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: An attempt to create a transaction under Windows 98, Windows 98 Second Edition or Windows Millennium Edition.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction.#ctor(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified timeout value.
member.param: The maximum amount of time the transaction can exist, before it is aborted.
member.exception: An attempt to create a transaction under Windows 98, Windows 98 Second Edition or Windows Millennium Edition.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified transaction options.
member.param: A structure that describes the transaction options to use for the new transaction.
member.exception: An attempt to create a transaction under Windows 98, Windows 98 Second Edition or Windows Millennium Edition.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction.BeginCommit(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an attempt to commit the transaction asynchronously.
member.returns: An interface that can be used by the caller to check the status of the asynchronous operation, or to wait for the operation to complete.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction.Commit
member.summary: Attempts to commit the transaction.
member.exception: is called on a transaction and the transaction becomes .
is called and the transaction rolls back for the first time.

member.name: M:System.Transactions.CommittableTransaction.EndCommit(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends an attempt to commit the transaction asynchronously.
member.exception: is called and the transaction rolls back for the first time.

member.returns: The object provided as the last parameter of the method call.
